intro: Hieracium sutteri, commonly known as the Sutter's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its clustered, yellowish-green flowers and is native to the western United States. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has a basal rosette of leaves and produces numerous flowering stems that rise above the foliage. Hieracium sutteri is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of ecological change in its environment.
